result.execSummary:
The defendant John R Lazare was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution, joint and several. 
  If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
No contact, direct/indirect, with Jakob Wirth. 
No contact, direct/indirect, with Dennis Cota.

Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Court will allow early discharge from probation if defendant completes all conditions and with the recommendation of the agent.

records.addlTxt: Restitution $1,985.45 paid in full to victim
Judgment/Lien Docket faxed to Crime Victim Compensation
on Petition for Early Discharge from Probation 973.09(3)(d) /s/ TTF 12/09/15

Defendant John R Lazare in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:06 PM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

State has filed an amended information.
Defendant will plead to Counts 1-3.
State addresses plea agreement.

Atty Sheets concurs.
Atty Sheets has received a copy of the amended information, waives reading of the information.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 3

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: contrary to the statutory statements as stated therein
Count 2: contrary to the statutory statements as stated therein
Count 3: contrary to the statutory statements as stated therein

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court, this is a joint recommendation.
Atty Sheets makes sentencing arguments to the Court, Defendant has a check that will be submitted today towards restitution, requests 60 days to start jail  sentence and electronic monitor. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 24 months
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 30 days
Half may be served on electronic monitor if approved by the LSI
Huber for employment and any counseling
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay restitution, joint and several in the amount of $8,252.63
Pay costs
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by the agent
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
No contact direct or indirect with Jakob Wirth
No contact direct or indirect with Dennis Cota
Will allow early discharge from probation if Defendant completes all conditions and with the recommendation of the agent

Count 2:
Jail sentence for 6 Months, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 1
Probation for a period of 24 months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Jail sentence for 30 days, concurrent to Count 1
Half may be served on electronic monitor if approved by the LSI
Huber for employment and any counseling
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Will allow early discharge from probation if Defendant completes all conditions and with the recommendation of the agent

Count 3:
Jail sentence for 60 Days, Imposed and Stayed, concurrent to Count 1
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1 and Count 2
Conditions:
If probation is revoked, will have Huber priviledges as granted by the Sheriff's Department
Half may be served on electronic monitor if approved by the LSI
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1 and Count 2
Pay costs
Will allow early discharge from probation if Defendant completes all conditions and with the recommendation of the agent
Plea hearing on November 17, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant John R Lazare in court with attorney Eric P. Sheets. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:40 p.m. case is called.
Address is verified.
Appearances stated on the record by ADA Cousins.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily, knowlingly and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant/attorney received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered on both counts.
Bond Continued
3:43 p.m. case is concluded.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Dennis Cota and Jakob Wirth.
Absolute sobriety.
  Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold.

Defendant John R Lazare in court with attorney Eric P Sheets. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Knaapen requests a $10,000 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Sheets makes statements re: bond.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
